descriptionHtml:
[center][font=Verdana]
[b][i][size=5]Patches for Requiem 1.8.2+
[/size][/i][/b]

[b]
[/b][color=#d8d8d8][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/9286/?][size=5][b][i]SkyRe Races Module[/i][/b][/size][/url][size=3][b][i] [/i][/b]by [/size][size=3][b]T3nd0 

[/b][/size][/i][/color]
[size=3]I kept all requiem starting stats and regeneration rates and tweaked a few Skyre Races abilities to match requiem balance. See the [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61411/?tab=5&&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fcomments%2F%3Fmod_id%3D61411%26page%3D1%26sort%3DDESC%26pid%3D0%26thread_id%3D2467079&pUp=1]stick post[/url] in the foruns section for a detailed description of each race.

[b]INSTALLATION[/b]
Install Requiem 1st, then install ONLY the race module from Skyrim Redone, seriously DO NOT install any other module. When asked to overwrite some requiem scripts, say NO to everything.

[b]NOTES[/b]
If you use my Bosmer Armor Pack patch, there s an optional file included in "Requiem Patches Optionals" folder, just replace the normal esp for the one in the folder. It will let Bosmer characters to craft enhanced versions of the new Bosmer and Bosmer Elder arrows.
[/size]



[size=5][b][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/11450/?]Enhanced Skyrim Followers - Aela the Huntress[/url][/i][/b][/size] [size=3]by[/size] [b][size=3]DreamKing
[/size][/b][b]

[/b][size=3]Load this patch after Enhanced Skyrim Factions - The Companions Guild, if you are using both.[/size]




[b][i][size=5][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62493/?]E[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62493/?]lemental Dragons[/url][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/62493/?][/url][/size][/i][/b][size=6] [/size][size=3]by [b]184Gesu
[/b][/size][size=3]

This patch change a few things from the original mod in order to make it fit better with Requiem, it should increase the game difficulty considerably.

[b]FEATURES[/b]
[/size][size=3]- Unleved Dragon leveled list so all new dragon types have a chance to spawn from the start, but lower/ mid levels dragons have a slightly increase change (~10% for lesser dragons, ~8% for normal dragons), other more "lore friendly" dragon types (like blood, elder, ancient and fire/frost ones) also have increased spawn change from ~2% to ~6% while most unique (and overpowered dragons) are more rare, around ~1% to 2% change for each but there is a good chance to find at least 1 of then often.
- Removed NPCs protection from Dragons, now they can kill NPCs normaly.
- Removed Dragon protection from NPCs, they can harm dragons normaly (if they live enough).
- Completely rebalanced Dragon shouts/ spells trying to match Requiem original intended balance. Some low level dragons should be easier then Requiem default, but mid/ high level ones (and the unique dragons) should pose a greater challenge.
[/size][size=3]- No changes were made to the dragons strengths and weaknesses, but all dragons have the Requiem default 80% poison resistance that will stack with the unique resistances of each dragons (note that some ED dragons already have very high poison res and add Requiem bonus, they will be immune to poisons, while other dragons are VERY weak to poisons, thus the requiem bonus will counter this weak spot a bit).

[/size][size=3][b]NOTES
[/b][/size][size=3]- Proper bash tags were added to this patch in case you want to use this with Deadly Dragons, since you will need a bashed patch, but this will only solve the leveled list conflict. Most DD features won`t apply to ED dragons but nothing game breaking.
- If you want to use this with Dragon Combat Overhaul, load DCO patch after my mod, but again, not all DCO features will work with ED dragons and there may be odd behaviour from dragons... or not.
- Optional esp is included in "Requiem Patches Optionals" folder for Realistic Needs and DIseases users, it will just make the new Dragon meat satiate your hungry, just replace the original file,[/size]




[color=#d8d8d8][size=6][i][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/21120/?][b][size=5][i]Heavy Armory - New Weapons[/i][/size][/b][/url][size=3] by [/size][size=3]PrivateEye 

[/size][/b][/i][/size][/color]
[size=3]This patch requires [/size][size=3][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49791/?]Complete Crafting Overhaul Remade[/url] by kryptopyr`s and its supported version of heavy armory (with support for Weapons & Armor Fixes' True Orcish and Daedric Weapons).

[b]FEATURES[/b]
- Balances Heavy Armory weapons with Requiem ones, solve leveled list conflicts (no need for bashed patch) and keep it true to requiem`s standards. 
- Dawnguard weapons have been fixed, vanilla and add ones are now considered silver and new ones have Requiem`s added enchantments.

[b]INSTALLATION[/b]
Install Heavy Armory - New Weapons as described in [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/49791/?]CCOR page[/url] under "MODS WITH CCO SUPPORT" section. It s a single esp with all Heavy Armory content, if you use the original version of Heavy Armory and its Dragonborn Addon my patch won`t cover the DLC weapons.

[b]NOTES[/b]
Highly recommended to use this with UnmeiX`s [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61520/?tab=4&&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fcomments%2F%3Fmod_id%3D61520%26page%3D1%26sort%3DDESC%26pid%3D0%26thread_id%3D2454284&pUp=1]KFR - Kryptopyr's Fixes Reqtified (Requiem-WAFR-CCF)[/url], place my patch just after his so that you can get the Dawnguard weapons fixes.[/size]





[b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/52224/?][size=5][i]The Dawnguard Brotherhood[/i][/size][/url][/b][size=3][i][b] [/b][/i]by [/size][b][size=3]UWShocks
[/size][/b]

[size=3]Reqtified Ranged weapons, Blessed Steel Swords now also have the silver bonus (or they would be a really bad alternative to normal silver weapons), bandoliers were a bit nerfed and Frost Troll summon now match Requiem Frost Trolls.[/size]





[size=5][b][i][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/57870/?]The Huntsman[/url] [/i][/b][/size][size=3]by [b]InsanitySorrow (Experimental Patch)
[/b][/size]

[size=3]It looks good in Tes5Edit, all tiers were Reqtified, matching a Requiem`s Hunting bow in tier 1, in tier 5 it becomes a heavy bow and in tier 6 it s similar to an imperial bow in stats. But the bow should also level with the player. I ll test it soon, just experimental for now.[/size]





[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/37289/?][size=5][i][b]Bosmer Armor Pack[/b][/i][/size][/url][size=3] by [/size][b][size=3]Maty743
[/size][/b]

[size=3]Solved lvled list and crafting recipes conflicts and reqtified ranged weapons. Optional file included for [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/61520/?tab=4&&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fcomments%2F%3Fmod_id%3D61520%26page%3D1%26sort%3DDESC%26pid%3D0%26thread_id%3D2454284&pUp=1]KFR - Kryptopyr's Fixes Reqtified (Requiem-WAFR-CCF)[/url] users, to adjust the new projectiles to his.[/size][/font][/center]
author: Alex9ndre

files.name: Requiem - Enhanced Skyrim Followers - Aela the Huntress
